data.title: Reva Shayne Lewis O’Neill
data.meta_description: Posts about Reva Shayne Lewis O’Neill written by glmanny
data.text:
This is the thirteenth in an irregular feature where we will report updates on what cast members of Guiding Light are doing now.

There is so much going on right now that I’ve been holding off posting this planning to get it all caught up. I decided this was long enough as it is. So I’m going to go ahead and post, but I think there will be enough for part 14 soon. Watch for it.

Tina Sloan‘s (Lillian Raines) long awaited book Changing Shoes has finally been released. Listen to an interview about it here: ‘Schmootz On Podcast with Changing Shoes’ http://bit.ly/bJAt53 Here’s a review. http://exm.nr/c4aTlP Sloan reports she’s coming to “DAYTON coming there to Books & Company on Sat. Oct 16 at 1pm. see you then.”

Gina Tognoni (Dinah Marler #4) was interviewed on Tune in Tomorrow.

http://www.blogtalkradio.com/tuneintomorrow/2010/09/13/gina-tognoni-1

Jerry ver Dorn (Ross Marler) has shared photos of Kim Zimmer‘s (Reva Shayne Lewis O’Neill) first day back on One Life to Live as Echo.

http://www.jerryverdorn.com/JERRYS-PERSONAL-PICS-15.htm

Jessica Leccia (Natalia Rivera Aitoro) was interviewed by We Love Soaps. http://bit.ly/aryugV

Now with a transcript.http://www.welovesoaps.net/2010/08/oltl-leccia.html

http://www.welovesoaps.net/2010/08/leccia2.html

Also, visit this fan site for her. www.jessica-leccia.net

Crystal Chappell (Olivia Spencer) was interviewed by Soaptown USA. http://bit.ly/buiHZm

Marcy Rylan (Lizzie Spaulding Lewis #6) has been involved in knitting lately and recently tweeted a photo of her in a sweater she just finished. http://yfrog.com/mj15ewj

When Frank Grillo (Hart Jessup #5) was asked about his wife Wendy Moniz (Dinah Marler #3) on Twitter. He replied, “she’s fantastic.”

Robert Newman (Josh Lewis) shared a bald photo of himself on Twitter, straight from playing Daddy Warbucks in a major regional production of Annie (No, no THAT Annie – See previous cast updates for more information). http://yfrog.com/n03j0j

Elizabeth Keifer (Blake Marler #5) is in the new movie Morning Glory. In this preview see her in the family shot on the desk. “Morning Glory: Trailer #1 – http://www.imdb.com/rg/s/1/video/imdb/vi3680175897/ Freeze frame “family” pic on Jeff Goldblum’s desk. hoot!”

Vincent Irizarry (Lujack/Nick McHenry) was announced as leaving his current soap All My Children, but it seems like that was negotiating tactics and it hasn’t yet been determined whether he’s staying with the soap or not. http://tinyurl.com/24s4dr8

http://www.welovesoaps.net/2010/09/irizarry.html

More on Kim Zimmer‘s (Reva Shayne) return to One Life to Live.

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10607

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10603

More on Zimmer appearing in “Lost Boy Found in Whole Foods.”

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10636

In a second attempt at a reality series, Frank Dicopoulos (Frank Cooper) and his wife, Teja Anderson (actress/writer) will escort a bride and groom through the process of planning a wedding in A New Jersey Wedding: Red Bank.

http://www.njwedding.com/bridalnews/a_new_jersey_wedding_red_bank_nj_discover.cfm

Reports on So Long Springfield cruise.

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10639

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10640

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10652

More So Long Springfield Cruise photos from the Talent Show.

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10644 (Part 1)

http://guidinglightcentral.com/topic/10645 (Part 2)

Thank you Elizabeth!

Now for a few related odds and ends.

YouTube takes on new more profitable attitude towards copyright material.

http://www.nytimes.com/2010/09/03/technology/03youtube.html?_r=2&src=twt&twt=nytimes

Fans upset, not only by As the World Turns cancellation, but also the stupid and senseless way they killed of Dr. Reid Oliver (played by relative soap newcomer Eric Sheffer-Stevens) and the last great new character added to the classic soap, decided to act for good rather than ruminating on the negative. They are aiming to raise $15,000 for Doctors Without Borders in honor of both the character and the actor (who asked fans not to send him any more presents). When I write this they were up to $11,500. This is a worthy cause and I support and applaud the effort to create something good out of this tragedy. I also salute the fans gathering the money because I’ve done that for group donations before and it’s really a lot of work. http://bit.ly/9xS7VB Since my initial write up they have passed $15,000 and are now trying for $20,000.

Click on the Posted in “GL Cast Update” category below for more posts about keeping up with the Springfielders.

I accidentally came across an old issue and this jumped out at me as something to share. This is from the July 29, 2008 issue of Soap Opera Digest.

“Jeva” Wedding Redux

On the heels of their unexpected smooch, Josh and Reva’s closeness continues this week, much to a jealous Cassie’s chagrin.

The duo is swept up in memories of their past and even recite their old wedding vows to each other as they watch Mark, Jolene, and the rest of the film crew re-create their 1989 Cross Creek ceremony. “I hope everyone will be as moved by it as Robert [Newman, Josh] and I were,” says Kim Zimmer (Reva) about revisiting the classic Guiding Light moment. “It’s a real gift to the Josh and Reva fans out there.”

For Reva, however, it’s bittersweet. “She’s reminded of all the love that existed on that day, in that place…always!” sighs Zimmer. Then, Josh makes a shocking admission, saying it was a mistake to leave Reva and that he can’t go back to Cassie after all that’s happened. “Josh becomes very moved and I think realizes just what he’s missing,” she adds.

After, Cassie and Jeffery are stunned to find Josh and Reva in another lip lock (as their wedding song plays). Upset, Cassie informs Josh it’s over, so they can say goodbye and he packs his bags. “Their ‘trust’ issue is also a communication issue,” shrugs Newman. They are on different planets right now.”

Read the article and see the accompanying photo in Soap Opera Digest.

August 21, 2009 – Ok, so is Shayne saying he mistook mid-40s(?) Edmund for Jonathan???? That’s some family resemblance or Shayne is REALLY out of it. I guess he means he thought Jonathan was someone working for Edmund, but that was not clear at all. It’s a great brawl though and I still think Jonathan deserves it for all the stupid stuff he’s done. I love it when Jonathan says “Yep” to Shayne something in the tone made me laugh out loud. A little goes a long way though and I was ready pretty soon for Shayne to punch him again. Apparently Shayne and Jonathan never met before and Shayne didn’t previously ask Reva many questions about Jonathan or his history with the Royals or his time in Springfield. [Minute 0, Minute 10] Jonathan finally tells Reva the “Jeffery Museum” is weird. [Minute 17] Later Shayne comes back and overhears Jonathan’s part of a phone call with Jeffery. Shayne assumes it’s Edmund on the other end. Dueling Lines of the Day = Jonathan: “You definitely are Josh’s son.” They admit they don’t like each other, but have to pretend for Reva’s sake. Shayne To Reva: “John Deere here helped me find it.” [Minute 30] (I almost forgot. Jonathan and Dinah had an affair, too. Maybe Dinah was trying to be GL’s Brooke Logan, something else to bring the brothers closer. Boy I really have to buy that sarcasm punctuation mark.)

Billy is starting to court Vanessa and they are both being REALLY cute. [Minute 1, Minute 20, Minute 23, Minute 31] Billy goes in for a good night kiss and expects more, but Vanessa shuts him down with a reminder that it’s only their “first” date. They both had a great time though. [Minute 32] Earlier, Vanessa ran into Olivia and talks with excitement about her upcoming date with Billy. She’s being pretty chummy considering she knows Olivia pushed Billy off the wagon the last time he fell and the breakup of Olivia’s marriage to Vanessa’s son Bill almost crushed him. [Minute 7]

Buzz and Cyrus are still working on the Jenna research. Mel drops off some final paperwork clearing Cyrus of everything and sees on the forms it’s his birthday. Cyrus: “Does that mean I’m free to travel now?” Mel: “Yes, if that’s what you want.” Frank: (Dryly) “Oh, happy day.” [Minute 2] Later Cyrus books a flight to Australia for tomorrow. [Minute 33] Blake sends Ashlee over to interview Buzz for the book. [Minute 8] Buzz found Frank’s dating profile and gives the appropriate reaction. [Minute 13] Blake talks to Frank about his finding his place with Olivia, Natalia, and the baby, but doesn’t bring up her experience with Rick, Ross, and the twins which would have been highly relevant. [Minute 22] Buzz tells Blake she’ll never find the true love she had with Ross again, but she needs to live in the moment and she could find something wonderful. Hmmm. Live in the moment to BLAKE. Yeah, she’s never thought that one. [Minute 26] Blake decides to contact Frank through his online dating site. She’s still wearing Ross’ ring while she does it though. [Minute 33]

It’s a new day and Natalia is taking round 2 in making everybody agree to her plan about the baby and say it’s the best one ever. She’s working on Olivia and Frank. [Minute 5] Mel is making cookies for Cyrus and Natalia is making cookies for Olivia, together. [Minute 15]Olivia isn’t biting. She tells Natalia she can’t believe her and sends her home. [Minute 23] Natalia comes back and Olivia sends her away again. [Minute 35] Frank wants to get legal papers drawn up for custody and rights about the baby. Natalia is not overjoyed. [Minute 27] Olivia is irritated with Blake once she realizes Blake knew about the pregnancy before Natalia left and keeps asking why Natalia couldn’t come to her. [Minute 16] Mel takes Cyrus the cookies for his birthday. Then grabs Cyrus twice and kisses him hard. [Minute 18] Then they break the bed. Mel gets spooked and backs off. [Minute 23] Olivia brought the flowers Natalia gave her to Reva since Blake said give them to someone to cheer them up. Reva doesn’t let Olivia know about Jonathan, despite their close connection (adopted aunt). [Minute 29] They really seem on good terms now though.

The Comings Next Week features some Phillip, Mallet is ready to walk away from Marina, an understanding is reached between Jonathan and Shayne, and Cyrus and Remy are up to something.

http://tinyurl.com/GLAug212009
